com.threecubed.auber

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.threecubed.auber.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The world class stores information related to what is happening within the game world. It should only be used within the GameScreen screen.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  World.SystemStates 
      static class  World.Tiles
      An enum containing information about all dynamic/frequently accessed tiles.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(AuberGame game)
        Initialise the game world.
        Parameters:
        game - The game object.

      • World

        public World(AuberGame game,
             boolean demoMode)
        Initialise an instance of the world with the given game object. Demo mode locks the player to the center of the screen, makes them invisible and expands the camera to view the whole map.
        Parameters:
        game - The game object
        demoMode - Whether to run the game in demo mode

      • updateSystemState

        public void updateSystemState(float x,
                              float y,
                              World.SystemStates newState)
        Update the sprite of a system to match a new state.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the system object (not the tile)
        y - The y coordinate of the system object (not the tile)
        newState - The new state of the system

      • getSystemState

        public World.SystemStates getSystemState(float x,
                                         float y)
        Return the state of a system, given the coordinates of the system object (not the tile).
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to check
        y - The y coordinate to check
        Returns:
        A World.SystemStates representing the state of the system
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a standalone system light is at the coordinates provided

      • getSystemState

        public World.SystemStates getSystemState(com.badlogic.gdx.maps.objects.RectangleMapObject system)

        Check to see if any of the end conditions have been met, if so update the screen.
